title: Transdisciplinary Simulation Education for Sustainable Architectural Design and Energy Efficiency Improvement

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge in architectural environmental engineering or mechanical engineering (HVAC systems), experience using energy efficiency analysis tools
context.additional_context: A simulation environment where in-service practitioners collaborate across architectural and engineering disciplines to solve real project problems.

learning_goals: Learners can quantitatively analyze building energy consumption patterns using VR-based simulation tools
Learners can propose sustainable design strategies considering architectural design and HVAC system integration
Learners can collaboratively derive creative energy efficiency improvement solutions with peers from diverse academic backgrounds
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
